qas.question: When did the UN ask Tuvalu to come up with a plan to improve drinking water?
What did Tuvalu develop as a safe water strategy?
What is the per person per day targeted use of water for Tuvalu?
What organization called for Tuvalu to  improve its water and sanitation systems?
What group ultimately sponsored the Tuvalu water resources policy?

context: In <a0_0>July 2012<a0_0/> a <a3_0>United Nations<a3_0/> Special Rapporteur called on the Tuvalu Government to develop a national water strategy to improve access to safe drinking water and sanitation. In 2012, Tuvalu developed a <a1_0>National Water Resources Policy<a1_0/> under the Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM) Project and the Pacific Adaptation to Climate Change (PACC) Project, which are sponsored by the <a4_0>Global Environment Fund<a4_0/>/SOPAC. Government water planning has established a target of between <a2_0>50 and 100L<a2_0/> of water per person per day accounting for drinking water, cleaning, community and cultural activities.
